page.title: 17Customs in the Cowtons
page.content: On October 31st, Halloween night, children wear masks and carry lanterns. They knock at doors and ask whether you would like a trick or a treat. A trick is given by the children, a treat by the householder, usually some sweets or money. November 4th is mischief night, gates are taken off and hidden, dustbins moved and various other types of mis- chief is carried out by children. November 5th is Guy Faulks Bonfire night. Village bonfires and firework displays take place. At country weddings, while the service is taking place, children tie up the church gates. Money must be thrown to them over the gate before it can be opened. At New Years Eve people visit other houses, the first visitor of the new year is called the 'first foot'.
